The Ministry of Health is making efforts to soon have a vaccine

This is information given by a representative of the Ministry of
Health at the regular Government press conference
held yesterday afternoon in Hanoi, according
to which the Ministry of Health coordinated with the Ministry of
Finance to report officially.  The Prime
Minister's Office issued Resolution No. 98,
Decision No. 931, allocating funds for the Ministry of
Health to centrally purchase
vaccines while waiting for the completion of
procurement procedures. The Ministry of Health has also proactively sought
Vaccine sponsorship from
domestic international organizations for the
expanded vaccination program for 10 types of
vaccines that can be produced domestically,
the Ministry of Health has reviewed the
regulations of the Ministry of Health.  law and purchasing
by order for
5-in-1 vaccines that must be imported, the Ministry of Health
has also assigned the Central Institute of Health Hygiene
to carry out procurement in the form of
open domestic bidding according to regulations.
of the bidding law explains B the
shortage of vaccines. The Ministry of Health said
that in 2023, implementing the budget law,
localities will proactively carry out
procedures to purchase vaccines from
local budgets.  facing many

From the eggs that seemed like they had to be
thrown away, a retired teacher
created and turned them into
extremely unique works of art to celebrate
Christmas this year. Teacher Nguyen Thanh Tam, 70
years old, lives in Go Phoc Thanh district.  Ho Chi
Minh City has just completed a collection of
Santa Claus from the martial arts stallion. Santa Claus
slings a gift bag on his shoulder. Santa Claus weaves a

Teacher Tam said about the collection.  This year there are up to
world Santa Clauses, but when people love

or get close enough to realize the beauty of
egg-picking, so now I'm
trying to figure out what to do.  Let it explode strongly,
right? For many people to know, the
product I put on the market was

Thanh Tam in 2000, who came up with the idea of ​​creating

eggshells.  To make Santa Claus, he must choose an
egg basket shaped like
Santa's belly
and use quail eggs for his face. In addition, when

clay to create a lifelike Santa Claus,
but the materials he made are all

Tuan came home from work and did not see his wife. Tuan

iata announced on December 6
according to iata the aviation sector Has
returned this year with
expected dragon profits Reaching 23.3 billion US dollars and
rising to  $25.7 billion next year
Global tourist numbers are
also expected to rise to historic levels with
4.7 billion people traveling in
2024 but iata said that while
revenue is  expected to reach a record
964 billion US dollars, profits may
not be as expected due to high capital costs
due to rising interest rates. In addition,
global instability including the current conflict
between Israel and Hamas  The conflict in
Ukraine will also have a negative impact on the
aviation sector, especially
through oil prices. In an effort to prevent the
risk of explosions caused by electric vehicle batteries,
New York City will begin
piloting battery charging.  Outdoor use of electric bicycles
starting early next year is
part of
New York's safe-driving charging program.
In the first phase, a group of
delivery staff, also known as
shippers, will be charging the batteries.  their e-bikes
safely in public.
The program will also test
new technologies such as battery exchange networks and
safe charging and charging stations, according to the goal of
New York City Mayor Eric Adams.
program is to take
electric vehicle charging
outdoors. Time and time again we
see electric bicycles with dangerous batteries
being charged in people's homes.
Unsafe charging is endangering people's
lives.
According to statistics from the
New York Mayor's Office, fires caused by
this type of battery have killed 18 people and
injured 133 people in New York this year.

too. Inspired by the character wi wka, an
artist created a painting  The statue of
the owner of this chocolate factory is
life-sized and made
entirely from chocolate. The work has just been
consecrated in Tranga Square, London,
England. The statue of Wily Wanka is 1.88 tall and weighs
100 kg of turmeric.  The chocolate sculptor Jen
Linse Clark was inspired by the character of the
same name in the movie Char and the
Chocolate Factory. The statue simulates the character Wka by
actor Timothy Salam
on the occasion of the new movie Wanka just
released.  We made it with clay and
then molded it with chocolate once
completed. We sprayed cocoa butter to
create a smooth and delicious texture
within five weeks. This artisan
worked with a team  made the model and used
more than 90 liters of melted chocolate, equivalent to
about 1,000 chocolate bars. Every detail
was made billions of dollars from the
thin latex jacket and shoes to each quail
to limit the pigeons from
tasting the work.  This statue was then
